tool.name: AddCommentToJob
tool.summary:
This tool provides a mechanism for adding comments to the history of a Workflow Manager job.

Note that for any jobs with an active hold, the user running the tool will need to have the privilege to override the hold and add a comment to the job.
tool.usage: • The default Workflow Manager database must be set before running this tool.

param.name: in_long_jobId
param.displayname: ID of the job to which the comment will be added
param.dialogReference:
The ID of the job to which the comment will be added.

The domain for this parameter is based on those jobs present in the Workflow Manager database that are able to have new comments added to them.
param.pythonReference:
The ID of the job to which the comment will be added.

The domain for this parameter is based on those jobs present in the Workflow Manager database that are able to have new comments added to them.

param.name: in_string_comment
param.displayname: The comment to be added to the job
param.dialogReference: The comment to add to the job. The text will be visible as a "Comment" in the job's history.
param.pythonReference: The comment to add to the job. The text will be visible as a "Comment" in the job's history.

param.name: in_string_wmxDatabaseAlias
param.dialogReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.
param.pythonReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This tool provides a mechanism for adding comments to the history of a Workflow Manager job.

Note that for any jobs with an active hold, the user running the tool will need to have the privilege to override the hold and add a comment to the job.
